# worldOrientation

**Instance Property**

The node’s orientation relative to the scene’s world coordinate space.

## Declaration

```swift
var worldOrientation: SCNQuaternion { get set }
```

## Discussion

This quaternion isolates the rotational aspect of the node’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/worldTransform] matrix, which in turn is the conversion of the node’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/transform] from local space to the scene’s world coordinate space. That is, it expresses the difference in axis and angle of rotation between the node and the scene’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNScene/rootNode].

## Related Documentation

- **simdWorldOrientation**: The node’s orientation relative to the scene’s world coordinate space.

## Managing Transforms in World Space (SceneKit Types)

- **worldTransform**: The world transform applied to the node.
- **setWorldTransform(_:)**: Sets the world transform applied to the node.
- **worldPosition**: The node’s position relative to the scene’s world coordinate space.
